items.label: thm-os2-reflection-positivity
items.title: Reflection Positivity for Crystalline Gas QSD
items.content:
260: :label: thm-os2-reflection-positivity
261: 
262: The quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ of the Crystalline Gas satisfies the Osterwalder-Schrader **reflection positivity axiom (OS2)**.
263: 
264: Specifically, for any Schwartz test function $f \in \mathcal{S}(\mathcal{H}_+)$ supported in the time-positive half-space:
265: 
266: $$
267: \langle f, \theta f \rangle_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}} := \int_{\Sigma_N} f(\mathcal{S}) \cdot \overline{f(\theta \mathcal{S})} \, d\pi_{\text{QSD}}(\mathcal{S}) \geq 0
268: $$

items.label: thm-os4-clustering
items.title: Clustering of Gauge Field Correlations
items.content:
403: :label: thm-os4-clustering
404: 
405: The $n$-point correlation functions of gauge fields $A_\mu^a(x)$ at QSD satisfy **exponential clustering**:
406: 
407: For configurations $(x_1, \ldots, x_n)$ and $(y_1, \ldots, y_m)$ with spatial separation $R := \min_{i,j} \|x_i - y_j\|$:
408: 
409: $$
410: \left| \mathcal{S}_{n+m}(x_1, \ldots, x_n, y_1, \ldots, y_m) - \mathcal{S}_n(x_1, \ldots, x_n) \cdot \mathcal{S}_m(y_1, \ldots, y_m) \right|
411: $$
412: 
413: $$
414: \leq C_{n,m} \cdot \exp\left(-m_{\text{gap}} \cdot R\right)
415: $$
416: 
417: where the **mass gap** is:
418: 
419: $$
420: m_{\text{gap}} := \frac{1}{2\sigma}
421: $$
items.raw_directive:

406:

408:

411: $$
412: 
413: $$
414: \leq C_{n,m} \cdot \exp\left(-m_{\text{gap}} \cdot R\right)
415: $$

418:

677: ### Schwinger Functions as Tempered Distributions
678: 
679: :::{prf:theorem} OS0: Regularity Axiom for Crystalline Gas
680: :label: thm-os0-regularity
681: 
682: The $n$-point Schwinger functions:
683: 
684: $$
685: \mathcal{S}_n(x_1, \ldots, x_n) := \int_{\Sigma_N} \prod_{j=1}^{n} A_{\mu_j}^{a_j}(x_j) \, d\pi_{\text{QSD}}(\mathcal{S})
686: $$
687: 
688: are **tempered distributions** in $\mathcal{S}'(\mathbb{R}^{4n})$.
689: 
690: Specifically, there exist constants $C_n, M_n > 0$ such that:
691: 
692: $$
693: |\mathcal{S}_n(x_1, \ldots, x_n)| \leq C_n \prod_{j=1}^{n} (1 + \|x_j\|^2)^{M_n}

871: ### QSD Euclidean Invariance
872: 
873: :::{prf:theorem} OS1: Euclidean Invariance for Crystalline Gas
874: :label: thm-os1-euclidean-invariance
875: 
876: The quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is invariant under the Euclidean group $E(4) = \text{SO}(4) \ltimes \mathbb{R}^4$:
877: 
878: $$
879: \pi_{\text{QSD}}(g \cdot \mathcal{S}) = \pi_{\text{QSD}}(\mathcal{S})
880: $$
881: 
882: for all $g = (R, a) \in E(4)$ and swarm configurations $\mathcal{S} \in \Sigma_N$.
883: 
884: Consequently, the Schwinger functions satisfy:
885: 
886: $$
887: \mathcal{S}_n(g \cdot x_1, \ldots, g \cdot x_n) = \mathcal{S}_n(x_1, \ldots, x_n)

972: The symmetry axiom states that Schwinger functions are symmetric under permutation of identical field insertions. This is essentially trivial for bosonic gauge fields.
973: 
974: :::{prf:theorem} OS3: Permutation Symmetry for Crystalline Gas
975: :label: thm-os3-permutation-symmetry
976: 
977: For any permutation $\sigma \in S_n$ and field insertions with identical Lorentz and gauge indices:
978: 
979: $$
980: \mathcal{S}_n(x_{\sigma(1)}, \ldots, x_{\sigma(n)}) = \mathcal{S}_n(x_1, \ldots, x_n)
981: $$
982: 
983: More generally, for gauge fields with different indices:
984: 
985: $$
986: \mathcal{S}_n\left(A_{\mu_1}^{a_1}(x_1), \ldots, A_{\mu_n}^{a_n}(x_n)\right)
987: $$
988: 
989: is symmetric under permutations $\sigma$ that preserve the index structure:
990: 
991: $$
992: (\mu_{\sigma(j)}, a_{\sigma(j)}, x_{\sigma(j)}) = (\mu_j, a_j, x_j)

items.label: thm-os-wightman-reconstruction
items.title: Wightman Reconstruction
items.content:
1052: :label: thm-os-wightman-reconstruction
1053: 
1054: By the **Osterwalder-Schrader reconstruction theorem** (Osterwalder & Schrader, 1973, 1975), the verified axioms OS0-OS4 imply the existence of a **relativistic quantum Yang-Mills theory** in Minkowski spacetime $\mathbb{R}^{1,3}$ satisfying the Wightman axioms:
1055: 
1056: 1. **Relativistic covariance** (Poincaré symmetry)
1057: 2. **Spectrum condition** (positive energy)
1058: 3. **Locality** (microcausality)
1059: 4. **Vacuum state** exists and is unique
1060: 5. **Mass gap**: $m_{\text{gap}} = \frac{1}{2\sigma} > 0$
